original: Visākhapañcālaputtattheragāthā🔽“Na ukkhipe no ca parikkhipe pare,
analyzed: visākha pañcālaputta tthera gāthā  na ukkhipe no ca parikkhipe pare
translated: The Elder Visākhapañcālaputta 🔽Don’t throw out or despise others,

analyzed: na okkhipe pāra gatam na eraye
translated: Don’t throw away one who has gone beyond or be lustful;
Don’t speak in assemblies about the four social classes,

analyzed: su su khuma nipuṇa attha dassinā
translated: One who sees the meaning of the very subtle and refined,
Skilled in thought, of restrained conduct;
One who has attended to the elders’ virtue,
Nibbāna is not difficult to attain for him.”
